intro: Hydrolea cryptantha var. meridionalis, commonly known as the Southern Hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. The species is part of the Aizoaceae family, known for its diversity of succulent species.
